title: Why is man a part of the animal kingdom? - Quora

response.answer_text: Definition of an animal: Any and all multicellular, heterotrophic organisms and/or species who must ingest and digest other organisms and/or their products for sustenance and survival through an internal digestive tract by taking in food and liquids through the mouth, and expelling those as waste products in the form of feces and urine out through the anus and urethra respectively. All humans fitted/fit/will fit this very obvious description of what an animal is, and what an animal does. See links below: Welcome to Evolution 101! If you go according to scientific classification, which is how all living things are classified into kingdom, phyla, class, family etc, thenKingdom: Animalia (we are animals, not plants or fungi)Phylum: Chordata (have spinal cord)Class: Mammalia (we have hair or fur, three middle ear bones and nourish with milk)Order: Primates (we’re in the monkey and ape relatives_Family: Hominidae (includes chimps, gorillas, orangutangs)Genus: Homo (the only living member of the genus that included the extinct Neandertals, Australopithicus, and a bunch of others no longer among us.Species: sapiens So we’re animals, specifically mammals. We have animal behaviors we share with even less complex animals and we have behaviors and traits all unique to humans. But we are animals.
